issue.title: Add support for ConstrainedStr as dict keys

repository.name: pydantic
repository.description: Data validation using Python type hints

body:
It sounds sensible.

I got curious enough about the details as to go and implement it: #332

repository.name: optimade-python-tools
repository.description: Tools for implementing and consuming OPTIMADE APIs in Python

body:
@samuelcolvin @tiangolo I'm trying to make an OAS3 validator with Pydantic and maybe generator, like OAS3 to Pydantic (even if only to exercise) but I got stuck quite fast on: https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/schemas/v3.0/schema.json#L93-L95.
How would one represent that?

Hi @pkucmus,
Please do not hesitate to open a new issue with your exact scenario.
I had a quick look on the `Info` part in the schema. Are you trying to create a model to generate this exact schema ? Are you worried about the `'patternProperties'` ?
If so you can add extra parts on a given schema. Here is an example for the `Info` part:

```python
class Info(BaseModel):
    title: str
    description: Optional[str]
    termsOfService: Optional[str] = Field(format='uri-reference')
    version: str

    class Config:
        extra = Extra.forbid
        schema_extra = {
            'patternProperties': {'^x-': {}},
        }
```

output of generated schema

```
{'additionalProperties': False,
 'patternProperties': {'^x-': {}},
 'properties': {'description': {'title': 'Description', 'type': 'string'},
                'termsOfService': {'format': 'uri-reference',
                                   'title': 'Termsofservice',
                                   'type': 'string'},
                'title': {'title': 'Title', 'type': 'string'},
                'version': {'title': 'Version', 'type': 'string'}},
 'required': ['title', 'version'],
 'title': 'Info',
 'type': 'object'}
```

issue.title: Resolve patternProperties

repository.name: datamodel-code-generator
repository.description: Pydantic model and dataclasses.dataclass generator for easy conversion of JSON, OpenAPI, JSON Schema, and YAML data sources.

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I recently attempted to ingest a json schema containing patternProperties and they were completely ignored (generated model and silently left out these fields).

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Per https://github.com/samuelcolvin/pydantic/issues/329, I think that patternProperties should generate a 
`var_name: typing.Dict[constr(regex=r'<regex_pattern>'), <patternProperty_object_type>] = {}`

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
I would also appreciate if it didn't leave out the fields silently, but I assume this would be the case if I used a verbose option.

**Additional context**
I love your work so far! Just doing my best to help by providing feedback.
